title: René Botteron
text:
René "Bobo" Botteron (born 17 October 1954, in <a href="Glarus">Glarus</a>) is a <a href="Switzerland">Swiss</a> former <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a> who played for various clubs in <a href="Switzerland">Switzerland</a>, <a href="Germany">Germany</a> and <a href="Belgium">Belgium</a> throughout the 1970s and 1980s.
Career.
Botteron started his professional career at <a href="FC%20Z%C3%BCrich">FC Zürich</a> in 1972 and won three <a href="Swiss%20Super%20League">League Titles</a> and three <a href="Schweizer%20Cup">Swiss Cup</a>s before he left in 1980 to join the <a href="1.%20FC%20K%C3%B6ln">1. FC Köln</a> side of the early 1980s, where he played alongside the likes of <a href="Dieter%20M%C3%BCller">Dieter Müller</a>, <a href="Bernd%20Schuster">Bernd Schuster</a>, <a href="Tony%20Woodcock%20%28footballer%29">Tony Woodcock</a>, <a href="Rainer%20Bonhof">Rainer Bonhof</a>, <a href="Bernhard%20Cullmann">Bernhard Cullmann</a>, <a href="Klaus%20Fischer">Klaus Fischer</a>, <a href="Klaus%20Allofs">Klaus Allofs</a> and <a href="Stephan%20Engels">Stephan Engels</a>. He had a short spell at <a href="Standard%20Li%C3%A8ge">Standard Liège</a> in 1982, where he helped the side reach the final of the <a href="UEFA%20Cup%20Winners%27%20Cup">UEFA Cup Winners' Cup</a> only to be defeated by <a href="FC%20Barcelona">FC Barcelona</a>, before signing for <a href="1.%20FC%20N%C3%BCrnberg">1. FC Nürnberg</a>. In 1983, he returned to <a href="Switzerland">Switzerland</a> with <a href="FC%20Basel">FC Basel</a> and retired in 1987 following the club's relegation to the <a href="Swiss%20Challenge%20League">Nationalliga B</a>.
He also played for the <a href="Switzerland%20national%20football%20team">Swiss national team</a> and picked up 65 <a href="Cap%20%28football%29">caps</a> between 1974 and 1982, but never played at any major tournaments.
